section.title: Introduction
section.p: This page and the following pages under "Documentation" are not a comprehensive manual for the DingsBums?! application. However it should contain all you need to get started. The details should be pretty much selfexplanatory - otherwise feel free to contact the author.
Additionally some of your questions might already be answered in the Frequently Asked Questions.

section.title: Downloading, Installing and Running
section.p: Please refer to the Download page for instructiona about downloading, installing and running the application.

section.title: Opening a Learning Stack
section.p: Opening an existing learning stack or vocabulary can be done in two ways:

ul.li: Use the dynamic menu items with recently opened files at the buttom of the File menu.
Get a file dialog by using either the "Open" button atg the buttom or the file -> Open menu.

section.p: The screenshots in the documentation are all taken from the samples files.

figure.alt: screenshot of DingsBums?! showing the file menu with recent files

section.title: Starting with a New Learning Stack
section.p: To start with a new learning stack just use menu file -> New or the button at the bottom right. You can leave everything as defaults and go directly to Edit -> Edit Entries to add a few entries to the learning stack. Only the fields "Base" and "Target" are required. "Target" is what you want to memorize by using the learning features.
section.note: If "Base" and "Target" is all you are interested in the you can hide the other fields in the "Visibility" tab in the learning stack properties (see Preferences and Properties).
section.p: See editing for more information about how to add contents to your learning stack and the terminology used.
